ovdesc.p: T24 Data Library - Shareware for T24

The T24 Data Library has been created to enable data to be copied between different sites easily. When a user or implementor of T24 has created data which he feels may be of use to other sites, he can save the data to the Data Library. Data should be saved into logical units, for example, Dutch Bank Returns, which may include report control records, enquiries, repgens and even programs. To save the unit, a record is created in DL.DEFINE, listing all the items which make up the unit. The data is then saved into the unit by using the V function in DL.DEFINE, with the operation set to S.

NOTE : As with all shareware, the distributor, in this case, Temenos, does not accept any liability for the data or programs contained in the Data Library - it is the users responsibility to ensure that all data and programs being installed through the Data Library are checked and tested thoroughly before being used.

When saving records, sensitive data (e.g. the name of your bank or your VAT registration number) can be replaced by specifying the characters to be replaced and the characters they are to be replaced with, on the data library parameter file, DL.PARAMETER.

Once units have been saved, the Data Library should be sent to Temenos Development, where it will be merged into one central library. This should be done by using the save operation in DL.PARAMETER (using the "V"erify mode in DL.PARAMETER with the OPERATION set to "S" - save).

Should you wish to restore data from another site, you should restore the data library from tape into an area on disk (e.g. /globus/DLrestore). Examine this file to determine which units you wish to copy into your data library, or whether you wish to copy all units, or only those units which have been created in the "from" data library more recently than yours. Once you have decided which units you want copied onto your data library, enter the requirements in the data library parameter file (DL.PARAMETER). You must enter an OPERATION of "R" to restore, then enter the UNIX pathname of the file from which units are to be copied (e.g. /globus/ DLrestore/F.DL.DATA should be entered in FROM.FILE), the names of the units to be restored or blank to restore all units (RESTORE.UNITS) and whether you wish to overwrite existing units (OVERWRITING = "Y" or "N") or only if the units on the from file are later ("L"). Then run DL.PARAMETER in "V"erify mode to copy the units.

Similarly if you wish to copy units from a data library in a different T24 account, you can follow the above procedure. If the file is on the same machine you do not need to restore - just simply enter the pathname of the from data library (e.g. /globus/test/F.DL.DATA).

When you upgrade your T24 database by running GLOBUS.RELEASE, your data library will be populated with the latest units available. Existing units will not be overwritten if there were saved after the ones on the data library on the upgrade tape.

TOP.LEVEL.ITEM is used to create a list of all data items associated with a particular record. When the TOP.LEVEL.TYPE and TOP.LEVEL.ITEM are entered, the fields FILE.NAME and RECORD.NAME will be cleared, then populated with the names of all the associated data items; then TOP.LEVEL.TYPE and TOP.LEVEL.ITEM will be cleared.

For DELIVERY, TOP.LEVEL.TYPE should the message type (the id of the record on DE.MESSAGE). FILE.NAME and RECORD.NAME will be populated with all DE.MAPPING, DE.FORMAT.SWIFT and DE.FORMAT.PRINT records for this message type, as well as the DE.MESSAGE record.
For ENQUIRY, FILE.NAME and RECORD.NAME will be populated with any routines used by the enquiry, as well as the ENQUIRY record.
For REPGEN, FILE.NAME and RECORD.NAME will be populated with the REPGEN.SORT, REPGEN.CREATE and REPGEN.OUTPUT records.

Whether data is to be "S" (saved) or "R" (restored). This field is only used when the record is "V"erified.

When the program is run in "V"erify mode, if the operation is set to "S" (save), a unit is created in the data library, with an id as specified in UNIT.NAME. The records specified in fields FILE.NAME and RECORD.NAME are copied from the live files into the unit in the data library. The fields SAVED.FROM, SAVED.RELEASE and SAVED.DATE on the DL.DEFINE record are updated with details of when the data was saved.
When the program is run in "V"erify mode with the operation set to "R" (restore), the following actions are performed:
i) Any new files (specified by releasing the FILE.CONTROL record) are created
ii) Records contained in the unit are copied into the unauthorised file, with a status of "IHLD"
iii) Programs are copied into DL.BP, but are not compiled (use EB.COMPILE to do this when required)
iv) The fields RESTORED.USER, RESTD.COMPANY, RESTD.RELEASE and RESTD.DATE on the DL.DEFINE record are updated with details of when the data was restored.
Defaulted to "R" if the data unit has previously been saved (i.e. if there is a date in SAVED.DATE); defaults to "S" otherwise.
"S" (save) or "R" (restore)

Defaults to "R" if the data has previously been saved. Defaults to "S" otherwise.

TOP.LEVEL.TYPE is used to create a list of all data items associated with a particular record. Valid types are DELIVERY, ENQUIRY, MENU, REPGEN and VERSION. When the TOP.LEVEL.TYPE and TOP.LEVEL.ITEM are entered, the fields FILE.NAME and RECORD.NAME will be cleared, then populated with the names of all the associated data items; then TOP.LEVEL.TYPE and TOP.LEVEL.ITEM will be cleared.

For DELIVERY, TOP.LEVEL.TYPE should the message type (the id of the record on DE.MESSAGE). FILE.NAME and RECORD.NAME will be populated with all DE.MAPPING, DE.FORMAT.SWIFT and DE.FORMAT.PRINT records for this message type, as well as the DE.MESSAGE record.
For ENQUIRY, FILE.NAME and RECORD.NAME will be populated with any routines used by the enquiry, as well as the ENQUIRY record.
For REPGEN, FILE.NAME and RECORD.NAME will be populated with the REPGEN.SORT, REPGEN.CREATE and REPGEN.OUTPUT records.

Specifies the name of the file containing records to be copied.

The file name should be entered without the "F." prefix (if the "F." prefix is entered, it will be removed) and must reference a record on STANDARD.SELECTION. Alternatively, if a program is to be copied, FILE.NAME can be BP1, BP2 or BP. When the programs are restored, they will always be restored into DL.BP, regardless of where they were originally saved from. On the restore, programs are not compiled and cataloged - use EB.COMPILE to do this.
If FILE.NAME is left blank and RECORD.NAME is entered, the FILE.NAME is defaulted to the FILE.NAME in the previous multivalue (multivalue 2 onwards).
